Cal Poly graduatesMaxwell Fong and Elan Timmonofficially launched Ulzi on Feb PERIOD  hoping to prevent sexual assaults with their new app that crowdsources safety PERIOD

The free Ulzi app allows users to track and be tracked by loved ones share their location withlocal emergency services and assist nearby userswho are in dangerous situations according to Ulzi PERIOD Triggering a yellow alert lets the user customize who responds in an uncomfortable or escalating situation PERIOD Users can activate a red alert when they want law enforcement and emergency contacts to know they need help PERIOD

If someone is in trouble nearby for example users in the vicinity can receive notifications PERIOD Then they are guided to the location to help and can record video to assist law enforcement PERIOD

Users can also use the apps routeplanning feature to plan their path to a location beforehand which friends and community members can then view and use to survey their progress to make sure they get home safely PERIOD

The app is available now on the Apple App Store and Google Play Store PERIOD

Ulzi went viral after starting a platform where women could share their stories of sexual assault PERIOD They have since been featured in the New York Times Washington Post and Buzzfeed PERIOD After reading the stories and understanding the challenges the women who shared their stories faced theFong andTimmon said they were ready to implement a real solution PERIOD

By launching an app emphasizing strong values like community and safety the company hopes to ensure that people do not have to worry about their loved ones walking home late at night PERIOD
